items.title: godot 4.6: what changes for you
items.description: this quick reference guide covers what actually changes in your day-to-day work with godot 4.6 and what you do differently now.
search: this quick reference guide covers what actually changes in your day-to-day work with godot 4.6 and what you do differently now.

items.title: split screen coop
items.description: viewports are windows into your game world. how do they relate to cameras? and how do you set them up for split-screen multiplayer? this guide explains it all.
search: how to set up old-style mutiplayer split-screen in godot 4 with a shared game world.

items.title: saving and loading games in godot 4 (with resources)
items.description: learn how to save and load game data efficiently using godot 4's resource system. this guide covers creating custom save game resources, handling complex nested data, and understanding the improvements in godot 4's resource saving workflow.
search: saving and loading games in godot 4 (with resources)
learn how to save and load game data using godot's resource system

items.title: understanding raycasts in godot
items.description: learn what raycasts are and how to use them in godot for both 2d and 3d games. discover how to set up raycast nodes, detect collisions, and implement common use cases like line of sight, ground detection, and instant-hit weapons.
search: learn how to use raycasts in your games

learn what raycasts are and how to use them in godot for both 2d and 3d games. discover how to set up raycast nodes, detect collisions, and implement common use cases like line of sight, ground detection, and instant-hit weapons.

items.title: ranged attacks with and without area of effect
items.description: learn how to code a ranged attack weapon that targets based on mouse position. this guide covers creating both targetted and area of effect (aoe) attacks using godot 4.
search: ranged attacks with and without area of effect
learn how to code a ranged attack that shoots projectiles based on mouse position, with and without area of effect (aoe) in godot
learn how to code a ranged attack weapon that targets based on mouse position. this guide covers creating both targetted and area of effect (aoe) attacks using godot 4.

items.title: setting up pixel art graphics in godot 4
items.description: learn how to configure godot's texture filtering, viewport scaling, and rendering settings to set up crisp pixel art with simple built-in options in godot 4.
search: setting up pixel art graphics in godot 4

items.title: learn gdscript from zero
items.description: try the app that converted thousands of people who thought they couldn't code. learn godot's friendly programming language in this free and open-source interactive course that runs directly in the browser! no login required.

items.title: 2d laser in godot 4
items.description: learn how to create a dynamic 2d laser beam in godot using raycasts, animated lines, and particle effects. implement casting, collision, and beam particles to create a visually stunning laser effect.
search: create a 2d laser beam with particle effects
learn how to create a dynamic 2d laser beam in godot using raycasts, animated lines, and particle effects. implement casting, collision, and beam particles to create a visually stunning laser effect.

items.title: kinematic jump formulas for 2d and 3d games
items.description: get ready-to-use formulas to calculate jump physics based on height, timing, and distance instead of guessing the jump speed and gravity values. you can reuse these simple formulas to precisely control jumps in any 2d or 3d game.
search: kinematic jump formulas for 2d and 3d games

items.title: juicing up your game attacks
items.description: ever wanted to make attacks feel impactful and satisfying? in this guide, you'll learn how to enhance sword attacks with layered visual effects, sound design, and animation techniques to add weight and impact to your game's combat.
search: this project gives an example of how to improve sword attack with layered visual effects and sound to help the player feel the weight of attacks.
